snippet.textDisplay: Hey Nokuhle, thanks for the video. I wanted to ask if I can submit a tax return if I was employed as a substitute teacher for three months from October-December 2020? I know this is late after the video was posted but I hope you can assist. Thank you in advance.
snippet.textOriginal: Hey Nokuhle, thanks for the video. I wanted to ask if I can submit a tax return if I was employed as a substitute teacher for three months from October-December 2020? I know this is late after the video was posted but I hope you can assist. Thank you in advance.

snippet.textDisplay: @Nokuhle Kumalo He Nokuhle. I submitted my return in August and I just received my money today. Thank you very much for your help.💜💜💜💜💜💜💜💜💜💜💜💜💜
snippet.textOriginal: @Nokuhle Kumalo He Nokuhle. I submitted my return in August and I just received my money today. Thank you very much for your help.💜💜💜💜💜💜💜💜💜💜💜💜💜

snippet.textDisplay: Hey, yes this is perfect you can (and should) submit your tax return for any work done between 1 March 2020 and 28 Feb 2021. The fact that you worked such little months gives you a really good chance to get a refund because your few months of working might not meet the tax threshold (which means they shouldn’t have taxed your salary to begin with). Goodluck ☺️! Do tell me how it goes!
